intro: Richetia balanocarpoides, commonly known as the coastal hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to the coastal regions of southern Africa. It is a shrub that typically grows in sandy or rocky soils along the shoreline. The plant produces showy, violet-colored flowers that bloom throughout the year, attracting various pollinators. Its leaves are ovate and have a rough texture, while its stems are often covered in fine hairs. Richetia balanocarpoides is well adapted to saline and wind-prone environments, making it a resilient species in coastal ecosystems.
